metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5612 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.5.50 and earlier, 5.6.31 andearlier, and 5.7.13 and earlier allows remote authenticated users to affectavailability via vectors related to DML.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient18 - 5.5.52-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libmysqld-pic - 5.5.52-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client - 5.5.52-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-5.5 - 5.5.52-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.52-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common - 5.5.52-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server - 5.5.52-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.5 - 5.5.52-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.52-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.5 - 5.5.52-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.5.52-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.5 - 5.5.52-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

mysql-client-5.6 - 5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.6 - 5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common-5.6 - 5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.6 - 5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.6 - 5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.6 - 5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.6 - 5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libmariadbclient18 - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-5.5 - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-common - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-5.5 - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test-5.5 - 5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.52-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mysql-5.6 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.6.33-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mariadb-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.52-1ubuntu0.14.04.1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
